results.title: JSA: Joint security area
results.creator_credit: Park Chan-Wook, Lee Eun, Myung Film, KTB Network and CJ Entertainment
results.brief_description: Powerful anti-war drama about an enquiry into the killing of two North Korean soldiers by a South Korean soldier on border patrol. Brought in to stifle a potentially incendiary situation, independent investigating officer Sophie Jean discovers that the group were once unlikely friends, sharing card games and good times. But subsequent enquiries reveal inconsistent versions of the tragic events that followed. A huge hit in Korea and Japan, “JSA” is a humanistic and sensitive examination of the discord between army officialdom and friendships amid supposed enemies. Adapted from the novel by Park Sang-myeon.

results.title: Joyful and triumphant
results.brief_description: Shows commercialisation of Christmas as evidence of public apathy to Christianity. Scenes of Christmas shopping are interspersed with the celebration of the Mass and a Nativity scene. Filmed without dialogue or narration. Photography by Bruce McNaughton.

results.title: Joyce Grenfell entertains: a selection from the works of Joyce Grenfell
results.brief_description: This is a compilation of Joyce Grenfell’s monologues and songs from her last television series in 1972. Born in London in 1910, and greatly influenced by her American mother, Joyce began performing at a young age singing and acting alongside her mother to entertain family and friends. Her talent for imitation brought her to the notice of Stephen Potter from the BBC. She went on to perform one of her monologues in “The Little Revue” and from there began to write her own sketches which were eventually recorded on a gramophone record. Joyce’s monologues were “light-hearted, shorthand sketches of character, suggested rather than detailed”. Her career spanned over several decades and crossed all forms of entertainment from the stage, radio broadcasting, recording, and motion pictures to television. During her lifetime she was admired and loved for her enthusiasm and her wonderful humour which although it made “fun” of certain human characteristics, was never unkind. She passed away on 30 November 1979.

results.title: Joyce at 34
results.brief_description: Joyce, a filmmaker, has her first baby at 34. She and other members of her family discuss the baby and how she is managing to continue her career. She represents any woman at any time who faces the conflict of work versus family. A sensitive and genuine portrait of the need for co-operation inside a family in order to achieve equality without guilt.

results.creator_credit: Paul Ferrara, Warren Brown and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Joy
results.creator_credit: Rachel Clements, Cate Shortland and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Thursday night. Late night shopping. Joy wants to have fun. This film follows a teenage girl as she hits the town in search of a good time. But Joy’s search for fulfilment leaves her lost and lonely at the end of the evening as we follow her to her unhappy home. By the director of Somersault (2004) Original format 35 mm/colour
WARNING: This film contains scenes that may offend some viewers

results.title: Journeys into the unknown : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Eight members of the community tell their stories of living with HIV. With a fierce zest for life and adventure, they tell of how their lives have changed but also of how they have fought back against the disease and look forward to the journey ahead.

results.title: Journeys in space and time
results.creator_credit: Adrian Malone, Gregory Andorfer, Polytel International, BBC, Carl Sagan Productions and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Cosmos: a personal voyage”.
In this episode Carl Sagan explores the relationship of space and time. He begins by showing how the shape of the constellations would change over millions of years, as the stars move and evolve, and then launches into a discussion on the speed of light and Einstein’s theory of relativity, concluding with the tantalising possibilities of time travel and parallel universes.

results.title: Journeys
results.creator_credit: Sheiny New, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sheiny New first came to Australia from America on a special scholarship program. While here she met her future husband and never looked back. She has since become a passionate campaigner speaking out against domestic violence in the Jewish community. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.
